clusters.title: Brisbane doctor revealed as mother found dead alongside daughter
clusters.neutral_headline: Mother and Daughter Found Dead in Brisbane, Australia
bullet_summary: Tiffany Wilkes, 54, and her eight-year-old daughter, Clementine, were found dead after police conducted a welfare check on the property in south-west Brisbane
Police are investigating the sudden deaths of a mother and daughter whose bodies were found at a property in Kenmore Hills in Brisbane

items.title: Brisbane doctor revealed as mother found dead alongside daughter
items.standfirst: Tiffany Wilkes, 54, and her eight-year-old daughter, Clementine, were found dead after police conducted a welfare check on the property in south-west Brisbane.
items.content: A doctor who used to work at a major Brisbane hospital has been revealed as the mother who was found dead alongside her daughter at a luxury Airbnb in the city's south-west.Tiffany Wilkes, 54, and her eight-year-old daughter, Clementine, were found dead after police conducted a welfare check on the Kenmore Hills property yesterday.The alarm was raised by a friend who claimed to have received a disturbing email from Wilkes.READ MORE: 'Not confident': RBA's bleak warning to millions of AussiesPolice are still investigating, but have closed the crime scene at the home and confirmed they are treating the incident as a murder-suicide.The last known images of Wilkes show her wheeling a rubbish bin to the kerb on Sunday.Speaking today, Queensland Premier David Crisafulli said it was a difficult situation for all involved."[It's] distressing for everyone, including the first responders who had to see something that no one should ever have to," he said.The property on Tinara Crescent was booked by Wilkes for a one-week stay and was one of many such stays the mother and daughter had been on in the last year and a half.Video shows her wheeling out a rubbish bin on Sunday, which is the last known sighting of her before her death. READ MORE: US to give Australia surprise verdict on $368 billion AUKUS dealDespite being a resident of Norman Park, neighbours said Wilkes and her daughter had not been seen in the area for about 18 months. Nine News understands she and her daughter had stayed at various hotels and Airbnbs since she was last seen at home, about the same time she left her job as an anaesthetist at Prince Alexandra Hospital.Police have asked anyone with information or relevant footage to come forward.If you, or someone you know, needs support you can call Lifeline on 13 11 14 or Beyond Blue on 1300 224 636.Suicide Call Back Service 1300 659 467.Kids Helpline 1800 55 1800.

items.title: Crime scene declared after mother and daughter found dead at Airbnb

items.content: Police are investigating the sudden deaths of a mother and daughter whose bodies were found at a property in Kenmore Hills in Brisbane.

ai_summary: A mother and daughter were found dead in a Brisbane property.
Police conducted a welfare check at the home in south-west Brisbane.

Authorities declared the property a crime scene.
The deaths occurred at an Airbnb in Kenmore Hills.

items.title: Iran was stunned by Israel's spy infiltration. Now it's exacting its revenge
items.standfirst: For 12 days in June, the world watched as Iran and Israel traded blows. What came next was a brutal purge of spies and traitors.
items.content: For 12 days in June, the world watched as Iran and Israel traded blows. What came next was a brutal purge of spies and traitors.

ai_summary: Iran was surprised by Israel's spy infiltration.
Iran and Israel exchanged blows for twelve days in June.
A brutal purge of spies and traitors followed the conflict.
The purge was a response to the Israeli actions.
The events highlight ongoing tensions between the nations.
